articles.name: Wishlist FAQ
articles.title: Wishlist FAQ
articles.body:
Want to make gift-giving easier for your friends? Wishlist lets you save your favorite Shop items directly to your Discord profile, so you (and your friends too!) can keep track of exactly what you want.

What this article covers:

  • What is Wishlist?
  • Adding Items to Your Wishlist
    • From the Shop
    • From Your Profile
  • Managing Your Wishlist
    • Removing Items
    • Privacy Settings
  • Gifting Shop Items from a Friend's Wishlist
    • Finding a Friend's Wishlist
    • Sending a Shop Gift
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is Wishlist?

Important: Wishlist is currently an experimental feature limited to a number of users on desktop and browser.

Wishlist helps you curate a collection of Shop items you'd love to receive from your Discord community. When you add items to your Wishlist, they appear on your profile where friends can easily browse and gift them to you.

Note: Items you already own, Orb exclusive items, and bundles cannot be added to your wishlist.

Adding Items to Your Wishlist

Ready to start building your Wishlist? Here are two easy ways to add items:

From the Shop

Browse the Shop and hover over any item card to see the Wishlist button or visit an item's details page and press the Wishlist button to add it.

Adding Shop Items to Your Wishlist from the Shop Tab

From Your Profile

1. Press your avatar icon in the bottom-left corner, then select your avatar again to open your full profile.

2. Select the Wishlist tab, then press Add item in the upper-right corner. 

3. You'll be taken to the Shop where you can browse items. Press the Wishlist button on any item you'd like to add.

Adding Shop Items to Your Wishlist from Your Profile

Managing Your Wishlist

Removing Items

Changed your mind about an item? No problem—you can remove items from your Wishlist anytime.

From the Shop

Browse to the item in the Shop and press the Wishlist button again to remove it.

Removing Items to Your Wishlist in the Shop Tab

From Your Profile

1. Open your Profile and go to the Wishlist tab.

2. Find the item you want to remove.

3. Press the Wishlist button in the upper-right corner of the item card.

Removing Items to Your Wishlist in Your Profile Board 

Privacy Settings

Your Wishlist is public by default so friends can easily see what to gift you. If you'd prefer to keep your Wishlist private, you can adjust your privacy settings.

1. Open your Profile and navigate to the Wishlist tab.

2. Press the ellipsis icon [] in the upper-right area of your Wishlist.

3. Toggle Public Wishlist off to make your Wishlist private.

Note: When your Wishlist is private, only you can see it. Friends won't be able to view which items you've saved.

Public Wishlist Toggle

Gifting Shop Items from a Friend's Wishlist

Want to surprise someone special? You can browse your friends' Wishlists and send them gifts directly from their profile. It's the perfect way to celebrate birthdays, special occasions, or just show appreciation to your community members.

Finding a Friend's Wishlist

Through the Full Profile

1. Right-click your friend's avatar anywhere in Discord—from a server, direct message (DM), or your friends list.

2. Select Profile to open their full profile.

3. Navigate to the Wishlist tab —you'll see all the items they've saved.

Viewing a Friend's Wishlist from Their Profile

Note: You can only view Wishlists that are set to public. If you don't see a Wishlist tab on someone's profile, they may have set their Wishlist to private or haven't created a Wishlist yet.

Through a User’s Profile in a Direct Message

1. Open a direct message with the friend you want to send a gift to.

2. In their Profile, you’ll see the Wishlist section. 

3. Select an item or view their full Wishlist to browse all their saved items and select the perfect gift. 

Viewing a Wishlist from Your Friend’s DM Profile

Through the Gift Icon in a Direct Message

1. Open a direct message with the friend you want to send a gift to.

2. Press the gift icon [] located to the far right in the chat bar.

3. Browse their Wishlist in the Send a Gift window—you'll see all the items they've saved, making it easy to choose the perfect gift.

Viewing a Friend's Wishlist within Send a Gift Window

Sending a Shop Gift

Once you've found the perfect item on your friend's Wishlist, sending it is simple!

1. Select the item you want to gift from their Wishlist or select the Send Gift button.

2. Add a personal message, a sound effect, and an emoji confetti (all optional) to make your gift extra special.

Example of Sending a Gift from a Friend’s Wishlist

3. Press Next, then complete the purchase to send it on its way.

Next Button

Your friend will receive a direct message about their gift, and the item wil be marked with a checkmark on their Wishlist since they now own it!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: I can't find my Wishlist on my profile. How do I see it?

A: To view your Wishlist, open your full Discord profile by selecting your avatar in the bottom-left corner, then selecting your avatar again. Once your profile opens, select the Wishlist tab to see all your saved items.

Q: How many items can I add to my Wishlist?

A: Currently, there's no set limit to the number of items you can add to your Wishlist. Add as many favorites as you'd like!

Q: Can I reorder items on my Wishlist?

A: Items appear on your Wishlist in the order you added them, with the most recent additions showing first. You can't manually reorder items, but you can remove and re-add items to change their position.

Q: What types of items can I add to my Wishlist?

A: You can add most Shop items including avatar decorations, profile effects, and themes. However, items you already own, Orb-exclusive items, and bundles cannot be added to your Wishlist.

Q: Is Wishlist available on mobile?

A: Wishlist is currently available on desktop and browser only. We're testing the feature before expanding to mobile platforms.

Q: Can friends see when I add items to my Wishlist?

A: No, adding items to your Wishlist is private. Friends can see your Wishlist when they visit your profile (if it's set to public), but they won't receive notifications when you add new items.

Q: What happens to my Wishlist items if I receive them as a gift?

A: When someone gifts you an item from your Wishlist, it's automatically removed from your Wishlist since you now own it. This helps keep your Wishlist up to date!

Q: Will I know if someone views my Wishlist?

A: No, there's no notification when someone views your Wishlist. Friends can browse your Wishlist privately to find the perfect gift for you.

Q: If I make my Wishlist private, can I still add items to it?

A: Yes! You can continue adding and managing items on your Wishlist even when it's set to private. Only the visibility to others changes.

Q: Can I hide specific items on my Wishlist while keeping it public?

A: No, Wishlist privacy is all-or-nothing. If your Wishlist is public, all items on it are visible. If you want to keep certain items private, you'll need to remove them or set your entire Wishlist to private.

Q: Can I gift someone an item that's not on their Wishlist?

A: Yes! You can gift any Shop item to friends, not just items from their Wishlist. The Wishlist simply makes it easier to know what they'd love to receive.

Q: What if I accidentally send a gift to the wrong person?

A: Shop gift purchases are final and cannot be refunded or transferred. Double-check the recipient before completing your purchase. Please visit our Refund Policy for more information.

Q: Can someone regift an item I sent them?

A: No, items cannot be regifted. Once received, items are bound to that account.

articles.name: Twitch x Discord Nitro Promotion 2025
articles.title: Twitch x Discord Nitro Promotion 2025
articles.body:
Starting from November 18, 2025 (12PM PT) to December 2, 2025 (12PM PT), Twitch users that purchase or gift 1 Twitch subscription in a channel can claim 3 months of Discord Nitro. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 3 months of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Note: This promotion is not available where Twitch Subs and Discord Nitro are both not available for sale. This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Ukraine, Russia, Iran, and North Korea.

We may add additional restrictions from time to time, if you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 3 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is not available where Twitch Subs and Discord Nitro are both not available for sale. This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Ukraine, Russia, Iran, and North Korea If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Claim through Twitch by December 2, 2025 (12PM PT), and redeem in your Discord account by January 1, 2026 (11:59PM ET)

Membership: After the 3 month trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings. 

What this article covers:

  • Promotion Summary
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Twitch?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Twitch account?  
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Membership Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Twitch?

Twitch is an interactive livestreaming service for content spanning gaming, entertainment, sports, music, and more. Learn more by heading to Twitch.tv.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Twitch account?

Note: The 3 months of Discord Nitro trial can be claimed on Twitch from desktop or mobile devices.

1. After the purchase requirement has been completed, you should receive a notification on Twitch about claiming your code. 

2. If you delete the notification or no longer see it, you can also go to your Twitch Inventory and scroll down until you see the Rewards section. 

3. Tap Redeem to get the Discord 3 months of Nitro.  

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by January 1, 2026 (11:59PM ET).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

Note: This promotion is not available where Twitch Subs and Discord Nitro are both not available for sale. This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Ukraine, Russia, Iran, and North Korea

If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

Note:
- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Pressing the Promo Link/Copying and Pasting into your Browser Window

  • Start by directly pressing the promotion link or copying and pasting the promotion link into your browser window.
Note: If you're redeeming this Nitro promo link in the Discord Gift Inventory, enter only your unique 24-digit code from the Nitro promotion link in the following format: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX

Step 2 - Logging into Discord

  •  If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Create an account Page (Left) and Login Page (Right)

Step 3 - Confirming the Correct Account and Payment Method

  • Once you have logged into your Discord account, you'll see a new message asking you to confirm that you are accepting the Nitro subscription on the correct Discord account.
    • You'll see a notice saying: "You are accepting this gift as _________" 
  • If your Discord account does not have your payment information, you'll be asked to fill out your payment details. (Note: You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the subscription renews)
  • When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the "Accept Gift" button. 
Note: If you're logged into the incorrect Discord account, press the "Wrong account" button to login to the other account.

Step 4 - Subscription Now Activated

  • After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro subscription on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 3 month Nitro membership.

Important: By choosing to activate this 3 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current subscriptions, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current subscription**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to redeem the Nitro subscription link, you can share this link with a friend to use instead.

After you press on and open the promotion link, you can directly copy the promotion URL link in the new page and send it to a friend. We recommend sending the link in a private direct message. Make sure your friend redeems the code by January 1, 2026 (11:59PM ET).

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Twitch users can claim Discord Nitro promo between November 18, 2025 (12PM PT) to December 2, 2025 (12PM PT).

After December 2, 2025 (12PM PT), Twitch users will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by January 1, 2026 (11:59PM ET).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by January 1, 2026 (11:59PM ET), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 3 months of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from their Twitch account?

A: Offer applicable to purchase of one (1) new subscription or gift subscription of any tier on any live channel on Twitch.tv that has enabled the offer; not applicable to existing recurring subscriptions or Prime subscriptions. Offer not available where Twitch Subs and Discord Nitro are both not available for sale. Twitch reserves the right to modify or cancel this offer at any time.

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

Note: This promotion is not available where Twitch Subs and Discord Nitro are both not available for sale. This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Ukraine, Russia, Iran, and North Korea. 

If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 3 months Nitro membership.

Important: By choosing to activate this 3 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current subscriptions, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current subscription**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 3 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 3 months.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 3 months perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "Looks like this gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "Looks like this gift has already been claimed" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims.Only one user can claim one promotion code.  
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: I’m having trouble with my Twitch account..

A: Reach out to Twitch’s support team through here: https://help.twitch.tv/s/contactsupport

articles.name: How to Submit a Support Ticket to Discord
articles.title: How to Submit a Support Ticket to Discord
articles.body:
Need help from our support team? This guide will walk you through submitting a support ticket through Discord's Help Center.

What this article covers:

  • Support Account vs Discord Account
  • Submitting Your First Ticket
    • Create Your Discord Support Account
    • Submit your Discord Support Ticket
  • Submitting Additional Tickets
    • If You've Submitted Tickets Before But Never Set Up Your Support Account
  • Sending an Email for Support
    • First-Time Email Submission
    • Already Have a Help Center Account?
  • Tips for Submitting a Support Ticket
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Still Need Help?

Support Account vs. Discord Account

Your Discord Support account for the Help Center is separate from your Discord app account. 

This means:

  • You'll create different login credentials for the Discord Help Center
  • Your Discord Help Center password is separate from your Discord app password
  • You'll need to sign in specifically to the Discord Help Center to submit or view tickets

Submitting Your First Ticket

If you've never submitted a ticket to our Help Center before, follow these steps:

Create your Discord Support Account

1. Go to https://support.discord.com/ in your browser.

2. Select Sign in, located in the top-right corner of the page.

3. On the sign-in page, press on the Sign Up hyperlink next to "New to Discord Support" and you’ll see a new page to:

  • Enter your full name
  • Enter your email address

Then once you’ve reviewed your sign-up information, select the Sign up button.

Tip: At this stage, you won't create a password yet. Discord Support will send you a welcome email to set up your account.

4. After pressing Sign up, you'll see a message that says Check your email with instructions to look for a link to set a new password. Look for an email from Support (support@discord.com) with the subject line Activate account for Discord Support.

Tip: Check your spam folder if you don't see the email in your inbox within a few minutes.

5. Open the email and press the Activate account link. This will:

  • Verify your email address
  • Allow you to set your Help Center password (remember, this is separate from your Discord app password)
  • Complete your account setup

Submit your Discord Support Ticket

Once your Discord Support account is activated and you're signed in, you can now submit your ticket:

1. Choose Your Category

First, you'll see "What can we help you with?" with several category options, such as: Help & Support, Bug Reporting, Refunds, Cancellations & Payments, Feedback, and more.

Select the category that best matches your issue.

2. Complete the Form

Depending on the category you select, you'll see different form fields. Common fields include:

  • Type of question: Select the specific type of support you need (this dropdown changes based on your chosen category)
  • Additional category fields: Some categories may ask for more details like "What type of issue are you experiencing?" or "Platform" (Android, iOS, Desktop, etc.)
  • Subject: Provide a brief, clear description of your issue
  • Description: Explain your issue in detail. Include relevant information like:
    • What happened and when
    • Steps you've already tried
    • Any error messages you received
  • Attachments (optional): Add any relevant screenshots or files by pressing "Add file" or dragging files into the designated area

3. Submit Your Ticket

Review all your information and press the "Submit" button to send your ticket to our Support team.

4. Check Your Email

You'll receive a confirmation email with your ticket number. Save this for your records and use it to track your ticket status.

Submitting Additional Tickets

If you've previously submitted a ticket, the process is even simpler:

1. Head to https://support.discord.com/ and press on Sign in in the top-right corner

2. Enter the email and password you created for your Support account

3. Once signed in, press Submit a request and fill out the ticket form with details about your new issue

4. Once you're finished filling out the details, press on Submit to submit your ticket.

5. When you're signed in, you can view all your previous tickets and their status by pressing on your profile or navigating to My activities or Requests.

Tip: If you've forgotten your password or have never set a password for your support account, use the "Forgot password?" link and follow the prompts to reset your password

If You've Submitted Tickets Before But Never Set Up Your Support Account

If you previously submitted tickets via email but never activated your Help Center account or set a password, and attempt to sign up using that email address, you'll receive a message stating: 

"Discord Support sign-up attempt"

In this case:

  • Press "reset your password" from the email you receive
  • Complete the password setup process to gain full access to your Discord Help Center account
  • Once set up, you can view all your previous tickets and submit new ones through the portal

Sending an Email for Support

First-Time Email Submission

If this is your first time contacting Discord Support via email and you don't have a Help Center account yet:

1. Send your email to the appropriate Discord Support email address (for example: samplesupportemail@discord.com)

2. Check for the activation email: You'll receive an email from Support support@discord.com with the subject line "Discord welcome email"

3. Activate your account: Press the link in the bottom of the email to verify your email address and set your Discord Help Center password

4. Your ticket is created: Once activated, your email will be converted into a support ticket that you can track in your Discord Help Center account

Important: The email verification step is required for first-time senders to prevent spam and ensure secure communication with our support team.

Already Have a Help Center Account?

If you already have a Discord Help Center account with the email address you're sending from, your email will automatically create a ticket associated with your account.

You'll receive a confirmation email with your ticket number.

Tips for Submitting a Support Ticket

To help our support team to resolve your issue:

  • Be specific: Provide as much detail as possible about your issue and include screenshots when applicable
  • Reply to the same ticket: If you have follow-up information about an existing issue, reply to the original ticket email rather than creating a new ticket
  • Check your email OR your Requests & My Activities tab for updates: Our support team will respond via email, so monitor the inbox associated with your Support account. You can also check your Requests or My Activities tab to review any updates to your ticket.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: I forgot my password and I can't access my Help Center support account!

A: If you've forgotten your Help Center password, use the "Forgot password?" link on the sign-in page. The reset link will be sent to the email address associated with your Support account.

Q: Why am I not receiving confirmation emails for my support account/support tickets?

A: Check your spam or junk folder. Add support@discord.com to your contacts to ensure future emails arrive in your inbox.

Q: I need to update support ticket information! How do I do that?

Reply to the confirmation email you received when you submitted your ticket, or sign in to your Support account and add a comment to your existing ticket through the Requests or My Activities tab.

Q: Help! I can’t find my support ticket.

If you're having trouble locating a ticket you submitted:

  • Check your email: Search your inbox for emails from support@discord.com with your ticket number
  • Search by ticket number: If you have your ticket number, use it to search your email or reference it when contacting our Support team
  • Check spam/junk folder: Ticket confirmation and update emails may have been filtered
  • Sign in to view your tickets: Log in to your support account at https://support.discord.com/ and navigate to "My activities" or "Requests" to see all your submitted tickets
  • Verify the email address: Make sure you're signed in with the same email address you used to submit the ticket
Important: Some in-app flows or internal processes may generate tickets automatically, and those tickets will not be available in your email or on the support portal.

Still Need Help?

If you're experiencing issues submitting a ticket or accessing your Discord Support account, try:

  • Clearing your browser cache and cookies
  • Using a different browser
  • Disabling browser extensions temporarily

Also, check out our Help Center for support articles that might answer your question!

Important: Your Discord Help Center login is separate from your Discord app login. Keep your Discord Help Center credentials secure and accessible for future support needs.

articles.name: Mention Suggestions FAQ
articles.title: Mention Suggestions FAQ
articles.body:
Mention suggestions on Discord allow you to easily tag and mention users who you’re conversing with in text channels, DM, and group messages. Learn more about how it works below.

What this article covers:

  • What are Mention Suggestions?
    • What do Mention Suggestions search for?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
Important: Mention Suggestions are an experiment released to a limited number of users.

What are Mention Suggestions?

Mention suggestion example

When you’re typing in a text channel and you want to tag a friend in your message, you can start typing the username of your friend and automatically trigger the Mention Suggestion pop-up. With Mention Suggestions, you don’t have to enter “@” before typing your friend’s username and you can simply press the TAB key to insert the complete username mention in your message.

What do Mention Suggestions search for?

Mention Suggestions search through the text channel/DM/group message you are currently typing in for users who can view the DM or have View permissions enabled.

The feature looks for the following types of names:

  • Username
  • Display name
  • Server nickname
  • Custom friend nickname
Tip: If a user doesn’t show up as a Mention Suggestions, it may be because the information is still loading from your Discord app! Mention Suggestions are dependent on what has been loaded locally on your device. To learn more, check out the Frequently Asked Questions.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Are Mention Suggestions available on the desktop, mobile, and browser apps?
A: Mention suggestions are only available on the desktop app at this time.

Q: How do Mention Suggestions work? 
A: This is an app-side feature -- meaning that any matching happens directly on your device, not on our Discord servers.  We don't look at your message content to make the match, your Discord app does this locally.

Q: Can I turn Mention Suggestions off?
A: Yes, you can disable Mention Suggestions by navigating to your User Settings, under Chat, then disable the "Show suggestions for user mentions as you type" option. 

The "Show suggestions for user mentions as you type" settings option under Chat within User Settings

Alternatively, you can right-click on the text field, go to Suggestions in the context menu, then uncheck the Mentions box to disable Mention Suggestions.

Mention suggestion checkbox option within the right-click context menu

Q: Can I use Mention Suggestions for server roles and apps?
A: No, Mention Suggestions are exclusively for Discord usernames. If you would like to mention a role or app, please make sure to type “@” before the role or app you want to tag in your message.

articles.name: Frequent Friends on Discord
articles.title: Frequent Friends on Discord
articles.body:
Frequent Friends is a feature available in the DM list on desktop and browser versions of Discord. It lets you quickly access chats with friends you talk to the most.

Important: Frequent Friends is an experiment available to a limited number of users at this time.

How does Frequent Friends work?

The users shown in Frequent Friends are those you message most often and/or spend the most time in voice channels with.

The Frequent Friends feature is only visible to you and no other user can see who your Frequent Friends are

Frequent Friends is not limited to users you have added as a friend on Discord.

articles.name: Discord Cloud Play Quests
articles.title: Discord Cloud Play Quests
articles.body:
Discord Cloud Play Quests are Quests that allow you to play games via cloud streaming directly in Discord—no downloads or installs required. 

What this article covers:

  • What are Cloud Play Quests?
  • How to Participate in Cloud Play Quests
    • Accepting a Quest
    • Game Authentication
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are Cloud Play Quests?

Important: Cloud Play Quests is an experimental feature on the Discord desktop app. Some users may not have access to this feature yet, or may experience slight differences in functionality as we continue to improve it.

Cloud Play Quests is a new experience that lets you instantly play games on Discord -- no installs. Unlike regular Play Quests that require downloading full games, Cloud Play Quests launch directly in Discord. Play for a set amount of time to unlock your reward.

Example of a Cloud Play Quest in Quest Home

How to Participate in a Cloud Play Quests

Note: Cloud Play Quests can be accepted on browser or desktop, but can only be completed on the Discord desktop app.
Tip: Always refer to your specific Cloud Play Quest card and follow the steps shown there to complete your Quest successfully. The card will contain Quest-specific instructions and requirements.

Accepting a Quest

Here's how to get started with a Cloud Play Quest:

1. Find a Cloud Play Quest. You can discover these in several places:

  • Quest Home
  • Quest Bar
  • Your Friends List
  • Server Member Lists
  • A user’s profile if they're participating in Cloud Play Quests

2. Accept a Cloud Play Quest. 

3.  If friends are participating in Cloud Play Quests, press the Try Game button. 

If no one is playing the game, you can launch the game directly in Discord and start playing right away. 

Note: Cloud Play Quests is an experimental feature and not all users will have access to the trial.

4. The Cloud Play Activity screen will open, showing you details about the game and Quest requirements. 

5. Press the Jump In button to begin.

Starting a Cloud Play Trial Activity via a Quest

Game Authentication

Before you can start playing, you'll need to authenticate with the game service:

1. After pressing  Jump In, you'll be prompted to visit a website for authentication.

2. You'll be redirected to the game publisher's login page (e.g., Epic Games for Fortnite).

3. Sign in with your existing account credentials or create a new account.

4. Once logged in, you'll be redirected back to Discord and the Activity will be launched.

Need more information?

After completing your Cloud Play Quest, you can claim your reward. Learn more about Discord Quests and how to claim your reward here.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Do I need to have the game installed to participate in Cloud Play Quests?

A: No. Cloud streaming allows you to play games directly in Discord without downloading or installing anything.

Q: None of my friends have the game installed for the Cloud Play Quest. What do I do?

 A: Cloud Play Quests don’t require you or your friends to install the game. You can launch the game directly in Discord and start playing right away. 

Note: Cloud Play Quests  is an experimental feature and not all users will have access to the trial.

Q: Are there any system requirements for Cloud Play Quests?

A: You’ll need a stable internet connection, a Discord desktop app or supported browser, and an account to log in. Since games run in the cloud, you don’t need a powerful PC or console, but performance may vary based on your internet speed.

Q: What happens if my internet connection drops during a Cloud Play Quest?

A: If your connection drops, the game session may end. You can reconnect and start again, and your progress will continue tracking once you’re back online.

Q: Can I play Cloud Play Quests on mobile devices?

A: Cloud Play Quests  can be accepted on desktop and browser, but can only be completed on the Discord desktop app. Mobile support may be added in the future.

Q: What should I do if the game doesn't start after pressing "Jump In”?

A: Try refreshing Discord, checking your internet connection, or restarting the app. If the problem continues, visit our Discord Voice & Video Troubleshooting Guide. For additional general troubleshooting suggestions, contact Discord Support with details of your Quest. 

Q: I'm having trouble signing in to the game service. What should I do?

A: Make sure you’re using the correct game service account details. If you forgot your password or can’t log in, follow the recovery steps on that game service’s website.

Q: My Quest progress isn't being tracked. How can I fix this?

A: First, confirm you’re logged in to your game service account and that you’ve met the playtime requirement. If progress still isn’t updating, try restarting the game session. For additional general troubleshooting suggestions, contact Discord Support with details of your Quest.

articles.name: Game Servers
articles.title: Game Servers
articles.body:
Discord’s Game Servers feature lets you transform your Server Boosts into dedicated game servers for popular titles, creating seamless multiplayer gaming experiences for your community.

What this article covers:

  • What is the Game Servers Feature?
  • How to Use Server Boosts to Enable Game Servers as a Server Owner/Admin
  • What to Know Before Joining Game Servers
    • How to Join a Server’s Game Server
    • How to Connect to Game Servers by Game
  • How to Modify a Game Server as a Server Owner/Admin
  • Frequently Asked Questions
Note: The Game Servers feature is currently an experiment and only available to select servers.

What is the Game Servers Feature?

Discord’s Game Servers feature lets server owners create hosted game servers for popular titles, giving their community a dedicated space to game together. This feature makes it simple for communities to set up, manage, and join custom game servers tailored to their preferences.

Note: While Game Servers can be set up and accessed through a Discord server, anyone with the game server’s IP address can join directly from the game, even if they’re not in the Discord server.

How to Use Server Boosts to Enable Game Servers as a Server Owner/Admin

Important: Game servers can’t be disabled within 7 days of creation.

The server owner or admin can use any available applied Server Boosts to unlock Game Servers.

1. With the correct server selected, navigate to the Server Boosts tab in the upper-left corner. Only server admins and owners can view this tab.
 

Example of Server Boosts tab in a server

2. In the upper-right, you’ll see how many Server Boosts are available and recent activity of Server Boosts. If you have enough Server Boosts available, you can enable this perk right away.

Example of Available Server Boosts

3. To apply Boosts to Game Servers, hover over the perk and press Create Game Server. A window will appear where you can configure your game server!

Create Game Server option

4. From here, you can select which game you want for your server. You can also see the minimum Server Boost cost for each game.

5. After selecting your game of choice, you can choose the following customizations for your game server setup: 

  • Game server name: Pick a name that will help members identify this game server. If you plan to make multiple game servers for the same game, this will help distinguish them from each other.
  • Location: Pick a location to host your game server. Tip: locations closer to your players will have lower latency during gameplay.
  • Plan: Select the plan that works best for your desired gaming needs. Game Server plans are available in three tiers across all supported games:
    • Starter: Entry-level option, best for small groups or lightweight setups
    • Pro: Mid-tier plan with more resources for mods or larger player counts
    • Ultimate: Highest-tier plan with the most power and flexibility
Tip: The Boost cost and server specs (like RAM and player slots, storage, and vCPUs) vary depending on the game and plan you choose.

6. Select Enable Game Server to confirm your setup and create the game server.

Game server setup settings

7. You’ll then see a confirmation message letting you know your game server has been set up!

Confirmation that your game server has been created

What to Know Before Joining Game Servers

Game servers accessed through Discord are hosted by third-party providers and aren’t moderated by Discord. Without Discord's standard safety features, you should take extra precautions to protect yourself in these external spaces.

Before You Join: Avoid joining servers hosted by people you don’t know and trust in real life or from well-known groups you trust. Be selective—these servers may have different safety features from those you’re used to on Discord, so your choice of which servers to join becomes your primary safety measure.

Protect Your Privacy: Refrain from sharing personal information like your real name, location, age, school, or contact details on game servers. Be especially cautious of anyone who tries to move conversations to other platforms, offers unexpected gifts or special treatment, or asks you to keep interactions secret. These are red flags for potentially harmful behavior that can escalate quickly in unmoderated spaces.

Use Available Safety Tools: Consider enabling any safety features the server offers like chat filters, allowlist controls, and moderation plugins. When creating your own server, use allowlist controls to limit access to known friends, enable moderation tools, and establish clear behavioral expectations from the start. Remember that these tools may differ from what you're used to with Discord's built-in protections.

Trust Your Instincts: If someone makes you uncomfortable, leave immediately. Your safety is more important than game progress, maintaining friendships, or avoiding awkwardness. It's never your fault if someone acts inappropriately toward you. Report concerning behavior happening in the game server to the server admin if you trust them, or use the game host's reporting system (like Shockbyte's support form). If you see behavior that violates our Terms of Service or Community Guidelines happening on Discord, please report it directly to us.

Stay Alert: These servers exist outside Discord's safety ecosystem, meaning the automatic detection systems and rapid response teams you might expect aren't available. Maintain strong boundaries, be skeptical of unusual requests, and prioritize your wellbeing over gameplay.

How to Join a Game Server

Once created, game servers will appear in the new Game Servers tab at the top of your server. This tab becomes visible to all members after the first game server is set up.

1. Navigate to the server you want to join the game server for and press on Game Servers.

Game Servers tab

2. Select Join Game Server for the game server you’re wanting to join. 

Join Game Server button 

3. Follow the steps listed in the instructions pop-up to join the Game Server!

Instructional steps on how to join a Game Server

How to Connect to Game Servers by Game

Palworld

1. Launch Palworld.

2. Choose Join Multiplayer Game.

3. Enter the IP:Port of the server.

4. Select Connect.

Rust

1. Press F1 to open the in-game console.

2. Type client.connect <IP:Port> and press Enter.

Enshrouded

1. In Steam: go to View → Game Servers → Favorites.

2. Select the + Add a Server button and enter the IP:Query Port.

3. The server will appear in Steam → Favorites and will show up in-game.

7 Days to Die

1. Launch the game and select Join a Game from the main menu.

2. Press Connect to IP.

3. Enter the IP before the colon, and the port after.

How to Modify a Game Server as a Server Owner/Admin

1. Navigate to the server that has the game server you want to modify and press on Game Servers.

Game Servers tab

2. Select View Game Panel to open the Game Server’s options. The Game Panel is your control center for advanced game server management. This includes adjusting game configurations and customizing various server settings beyond what's available on Discord.

3. You'll be redirected to a web browser where you'll need to log into Discord and authorize Shockbyte to sign into their app. Each game server has its own independent Game Panel with settings specific to that game server. You can learn more about navigating the Game Panel from Shockbyte’s website.

Important: For any questions about Game Panel features, settings, or technical issues within the panel itself, please use the Contact Us button within the Game Panel to reach Shockbyte's specialized support team.

Game Server panel

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What happens to my game server if I no longer have the Server Boosts to maintain it?

A: If you do not apply the necessary Server Boosts to maintain the server, the Game Server will be deleted after 3 days.

Q: Do I need extra Boosts to unlock Game Servers for my server?

A: Game Servers are a separate feature from your server’s Boost level. Boosts used to level up your server do not count toward unlocking Game Servers. To enable Game Servers, you’ll need to apply Boosts specifically toward creating a game server. Once a game server is created, the Game Servers tab will appear in your server.

Q: How many Boosts does it cost to create a Game Server?

A: The number of Boosts required depends on the game and plan you choose. The least expensive option starts at 3 Boosts, with certain games and higher-tier plans requiring more. All Boosts allocated go directly toward that game server, there’s no extra Boost cost just to unlock the feature.

Q: How many Game Servers can be created in one Discord server?

A: You can have a maximum of 10 Game Servers per Discord server.

Q: What does the current game server’s status mean? 

Server Status of a Game Server 

A: Depending on the state of the server, you may see a variety of different Server Statuses. Here are all of the available Server Statuses: 

  • Online: Server is online and available to join.
  • Offline: Admin manually stopped the server.
  • Sleeping: Server is in hibernation (≥7 days of no activity).
  • Starting: Server is in the process of coming online or restarting. This can take a few minutes.
  • Startup Failed: Configuration is required. An admin of the server must visit the Game Panel to change the configuration.
  • Missing Stock: Server location is out of capacity. An admin of the server must select a new location in the Game Panel to resolve.
  • Unavailable: Other error. An admin of the server can visit the Game Panel for more information.
  • Unknown Error: An admin of the server will need to reach out to Shockbyte support to resolve this issue.
  • Deleted: Server is in the process of being deleted. Once deleted, it will disappear from view.

Q: I need help with my Game Server that I created, who can I reach out to? 
A: If you’re an admin of the server, you can reach out to Shockbyte directly through one of the following ways:

For Game Server issues:

1. Go to the Game Servers tab in your Discord server

2. Press 3 dots [] next to your game server

3. Select Get Support to be directed to the appropriate support channel


 

Get Support option


For Game Panel issues:

1. Navigate to Game Servers tab > View Game Panel

2. Press Get Support from the left sidebar within the panel

Get Support option

Important: Discord Support can help with updating your game server information within the app and other in-app functions, but extensive, technical inquiries must be forwarded to Shockbyte Support.

Q: How can I disable my game server? 

A: As a server admin or owner, head to the Server Boosts tab > View Game Servers and then press Disable Perk under the specific game server you want to disable.

articles.name: Profile Widgets FAQ
articles.title: Profile Widgets FAQ
articles.body:
Widgets are customizable sections on your Profile Board that allow you to showcase your interests to other users, enabling you to express your identity in different ways. Discover how to personalize your profile, rearrange Widgets, and share your interests with others.

What this article covers:

  • What are Widgets?
  • How to Add Widgets to Your Profile Board
    • In Profile Board
    • In Profiles Tab
  • Managing Widgets on your Profile Board
    • Reordering a Widget
    • Removing a Game from a Widget
    • Removing an Entire Widget
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are Widgets?

The Profile Board is a surface on the user profile that allows users to express different aspects of their personalities. Widgets are customizable sections on your Profile Board that allow you to showcase your interests to other users, enabling you to express your identity in different ways.

There are currently four types of Widgets you can add to the Board: 

  • Favorite Game: Highlight your ultimate favorite game with an optional short description about why you love it.
  • Games in Rotation: Share up to 5 games you're currently playing, with optional tags to give more information about how you play.
  • Want to Play: Display up to 20 games on your wishlist that you're interested in trying in the future.
  • Games I like: Showcase up to 20 games from your gaming history.

Each Widget type allows you to select games from our database and personalize how they appear on your profile. If you can’t find a specific game, don’t worry– we’re actively expanding our games database! 

Widgets in Your Profile Board

How to Add Widgets to Your Profile Board

Note: Widgets are currently only available on desktop or browser and won't appear on mobile for you or anyone viewing your profile. Some users may also have special privacy settings for Widgets.

You can add Widgets to your profile in your Profile Board and in your User Settings > Profiles tab.  

In Profile Board

1. Press your avatar icon in the bottom-left corner of the app, then select your avatar again to open your profile.

2. Choose any Widgets you want to add to your Profile Board. Select a Widget and press the Add game button in the upper-right corner. You can also add games from the Suggested for you section.

3. Once finished, press Save to confirm your changes!

Adding a Widget Directly in Your Profile 

In Profiles Tab

1. Navigate to User Settings by pressing the cogwheel icon [].

2. Select the Profiles tab and scroll to Profile Widgets.

3. Press Add Widgets to begin customizing your profile.

4. Choose from any available Widgets. Simply select a Widget and press the Add game button in the upper-right corner. You can also add games from the Suggested for you section.

5. Once finished, press Save to confirm your changes!

Adding a Widget through Profiles Tab

Managing Widgets on your Profile Board

Reordering a Widget

Hold and drag a Widget to reorder it.

Example of Reordering a Widget

Removing a Game from a Widget

To remove a game from a Widget, hover over the game and select the Remove Game icon [].

Example of Removing a Game in a Widget

Removing an Entire Widget

To remove an entire Widget, press the Widget menu icon [] and select Remove Widget. A confirmation pop-up will appear where you must verify that you want to remove the Widget.  

Example of Removing an Entire Widget

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Who can see my Widgets?

A: Your Widgets are visible to anyone who can view your Discord profile, including friends and server members where you share mutual servers. 

Note: Widgets are currently only available on desktop or browser and won't appear on mobile for you or anyone viewing your profile. Some users may also have special privacy settings for Widgets.

Q: Can I add the same game to multiple Widgets?

A: Yes, you can feature the same game across different Widget types. For example, a game could appear in both Currently Playing and Favorite Game Widgets.

Q: What if I can't find a specific game in the database?

A: Currently, there are limitations on the games which can be added to Widgets. We're working on expanding our database to give you more options. 

Q: How many Widgets can I add to my Profile Board?

A: You can add one Widget of each type (e.g. Favorite Game, Currently Playing, Want to Play, Games I've Played).

Q: Do Widgets work on mobile?

A: Currently, Widgets are only available to edit and view on desktop and browser versions of Discord. 

Q: Can I hide specific Widgets from certain people?

A: No, Widget visibility follows your general profile privacy settings. You cannot selectively hide individual Widgets from specific users.

Q: Do Widgets show my real-time gaming activity?

A: No, Widgets display manually curated game lists. They don't automatically update based on your current Discord activity status. However, real-time gaming activity is shown in the Activity tab.

articles.name: 1 Month of Nitro for SteelSeries Customers
articles.title: 1 Month of Nitro for SteelSeries Customers
articles.body:
Starting from October 8, 2025 (6:00AM PT) to December 31, 2025 (11:59PM PT), SteelSeries customers can claim 1 month of Discord Nitro. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of Discord Nitro

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Note: To be eligible for this offer, you must have not subscribed to Discord Nitro in the last 12 months, be a resident of an eligible country/region, make a minimum purchase of $20 USD on SteelSeries products during the promotion period, and have valid payment information and a Discord account to redeem your promotional code.

Note: This promotion is not eligible in the following regions: Syria, Ukraine, Russia, Iran, and North Korea. 

We may add additional restrictions from time to time, if you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 1 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is not available in the following regions: Syria, Ukraine, Russia, Iran, and North Korea. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Complete a purchase worth $20 or more through either SteelSeries.com or KontrolFreek.com. An email with your 1 month of Nitro code will be sent within 12 hours of purchase, which can be redeemed in your Discord account by January 30, 2026 (11:59PM PST).

Membership: After the 1 month trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method for per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings. 

What this article covers:

  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is SteelSeries?
  • What is KontrolFreek?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from SteelSeries and KontrolFreek?
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Subscriber? 
  • How do I share my code with a friend?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Membership Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our subscription plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is SteelSeries?

SteelSeries offers gaming peripherals and accessories, including headsets, keyboards, mice, controllers, and mousepads. You can learn more about SteelSeries on their website here.

What is KontrolFreek?

KontrolFreek is the creator of Performance Gaming Gear that enhances the player experience by maximizing comfort and precision. You can learn more about KontrolFreek here.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from SteelSeries and KontrolFreek?

1. Head to SteelSeries.com or KontrolFreek.com, and complete an order worth $20 or more. Note: purchase of Arctis Nova Elite does not apply.

2. You will receive a Thank You email after the purchase. This is a confirmation email and will not contain your code.

3. A secondary email with your Nitro Promo code will be sent 4-12 hours after your order is submitted.

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by January 30, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

Note: This promotion is not available in the following regions: Syria, Ukraine, Russia, Iran, and North Korea. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

Note:

- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.

- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo link on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo link.

Step 1 - Pressing the Promo Link/Copying and Pasting into your Browser Window

  • Start by directly pressing the promotion link or copying and pasting the promotion link into your browser window.
Note: If you're redeeming this Nitro promo link in the Discord Gift Inventory, enter only your unique 24-digit code from the Nitro promotion link in the following format: XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX

Step 2 - Logging into Discord

  •  If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Step 3 - Confirming the Correct Account and Payment Method

  • Once you have logged into your Discord account, you'll see a new message asking you to confirm that you are accepting the Nitro subscription on the correct Discord account.
    • You'll see a notice saying: "You are accepting this gift as _________" 
  • If your Discord account does not have your payment information, you'll be asked to fill out your payment details. (Note: You will not be charged until the free trial ends and the subscription renews)
  • When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the "Accept Gift" button. 

Note:

- If you're logged into the incorrect Discord account, press the "Wrong account" button to login to the other account.

Step 4 - Subscription Now Activated

  • After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro subscription on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to redeem the Nitro subscription link, you can share this link with a friend to use instead.

After you press on and open the promotion link, you can directly copy the promotion URL link in the new page and send it to a friend. We recommend sending the link in a private direct message. Make sure your friend redeems the code by January 30, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: SteelSeries GG users can claim Discord Nitro promo between October 8, 2025 (6:00AM PT) to December 31, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

After December 31, 2025 (11:59PM PT), SteelSeries GG users will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by January 30, 2026 (11:59PM PT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by January 30, 2026 (11:59PM PT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 1 month of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from their SteelSeries GG account?

A: Anyone who completes an order worth $20+ on either SteelSeries.com or KontrolFreek.com.

Note: To be eligible for this offer, you must have not subscribed to Discord Nitro in the last 12 months, be a resident of an eligible country/region, make a minimum purchase of $20 USD on SteelSeries products during the promotion period, and have valid payment information and a Discord account to redeem your promotional code.

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is not available in the following regions: Syria, Ukraine, Russia, Iran, and North Korea. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 1 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 1 month.

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a trial promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is a trial, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

Note: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 1 month perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account

Q: I see a "Looks like this gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "Looks like this gift has already been claimed" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo link.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the link is invalid. If you've copy and pasted this link, we recommend you double check the link you were given once more and make sure it exactly matches the link in your SteelSeries account.

If you received this link from a friend, double check with your friend on the exact link to make sure that it matches the link in their SteelSeries account.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if your friend has given an invalid link and we will not be able to provide a new link.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: I'm having trouble with my SteelSeries or KontrolFreek order/account.

A: For assistance with SteelSeries or KontrolFreek orders and accounts, contact their support teams directly:

  • SteelSeries Support: https://support.steelseries.com/hc/en-us
  • KontrolFreek Support: https://support.kontrolfreek.com/hc/en-us

articles.name: Discord System Helper
articles.title: Discord System Helper
articles.body:
Discord System Helper enhances Discord's functionality by granting permissions to ensure keybinds and features work reliably in games with elevated permissions. Install Discord System Helper to fix keybinds and other features that may not register in games requiring elevated permissions.

What this article covers:

  • What is Discord System Helper?
  • How to Find Discord System Helper
  • How to Install Discord System Helper
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is Discord System Helper?

Discord System Helper improves Discord's functionality across games and apps by granting Administrator permissions. It helps ensure things like keybinds and other features work reliably while playing games that have elevated permissions.

Note: Currently, Discord System Helper helps ensure keybinds are working when you are playing a game with elevated permissions. We may add additional functionality in the future to help Discord features work more reliably.

Without Discord System Helper, games with elevated permissions may prevent Discord keybinds from registering, including:

  • Push-to-Talk hotkeys
  • Overlay toggle shortcuts and keybinds
  • Discord-specific gaming shortcuts
Important: Discord System Helper is currently in experimentation and only available for certain users on Windows desktop clients. It is not supported or necessary on mobile and web versions of Discord. 

How to Find Discord System Helper

When you encounter games that have elevated permissions, you'll see prompts within Discord to install Discord System Helper in a few different places:

  • In Game Overlay settings: 

System Helper Notification in Game Overlay

  • In Keybinds settings: 

System Helper Notification in Keybinds

  • In Voice & Video settings

System Helper Notification in Voice & Video

  • In Window Settings:

Discord System Helper Install Option in Windows Settings

How to Install Discord System Helper

Important: The Discord System Helper is currently an experimental feature available to a limited number of Discord users on Windows.
  1. On Windows, press Install on the notification that appears.
  2. Follow the system prompts to grant administrator permissions.
  3. Discord System Helper will install automatically in the background.
  4. Your keybinds should now work in supported games.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Is Discord System Helper an official Discord tool?
